feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for New Zealand issued by MetService
feed.rights: Copyright Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited, 2025. Licensed under Creative Commons BY 4.0.

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 80 to 130 mm of rain. Peak rates of 20 to 30 mm/h expected Tuesday morning. Thunderstorms and localised downpours possible. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: On top of what has already fallen, expect 40 to 70 mm of rain, especially about the ranges. Thunderstorms possible. Peak rates of 15 to 25 mm/h expected Monday night and early Tuesday. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: On top of what has already fallen, expect 40 to 70 mm. Peak rates mostly 10 to 15 mm, but 15 to 25 mm/h possible late Monday night. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: On top of what has already fallen, expect 40 to 60 mm. Peak rates mostly 5 to 10 mm, but 10 to 20 mm/h late Monday night. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Snow Warning - Orange
entry.summary: On top of the snow that has already accumulated, expect 5 to 10 cm of snow to settle above 500 metres, but 10 to 20 cm above 800 metres about the Mackenzie Basin and northern parts of Otago. Note, snow will ease overnight, but another period of heavy snow is expected from before dawn Tuesday until late Tuesday morning, especially in the Canterbury High Country. Impact: Travel disruption and damage to trees and powerlines possible. Cold conditions may cause stress for livestock. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal. Changes: Warning period extended.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Severe gale northwesterlies gusting 120 km/h in exposed places. Impact: Damage to trees, powerlines, and unsecured structures possible. Driving may be difficult, especially for high-sided vehicles and motorcycles. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Severe gale northerlies with damaging gusts of 130 km/h in exposed places. Impact: Damage to trees, powerlines, and unsecured structures possible. Driving may be difficult, especially for high-sided vehicles and motorcycles. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal. Changes: Risk of upgrading to Red now minimal.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Strong Wind Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Severe gale northwesterlies gusting 120 km/h. Impact: Damage to trees, powerlines, and unsecured structures possible. Driving may be difficult, especially for high-sided vehicles and motorcycles. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal.

entry.title: Strong Wind Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Southwest winds gusting 120 km/h in exposed places. Impact: Damage to trees, powerlines, and unsecured structures possible. Driving may be difficult, especially for high-sided vehicles and motorcycles. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal. Changes: Upgraded to orange wind warning.

entry.title: Heavy Snow Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy snow above 300 metres, where snowfall amounts may approach warning criteria. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate.

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Expect 5 to 10 cm of snow to accumulate above 700 metres with lesser amounts down to 400 metres.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Snow showers lowering to 800 metres, with 2 to 4 cm possibly settling on the road near the summit, with lesser amounts to 800 metres.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Expect 2 to 4 cm to accumulate near the summit of the road, and lesser amounts to lower levels.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: A few snow showers are expected on Tuesday, and 3 to 6 cm is likely to settle on the road above 600 metres from early morning through to early evening, with lesser amounts to lower levels.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Expect 5 to 10 cm of snow to accumulate above 500 metres, with lesser amounts at lower levels.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Road Snowfall Warning
entry.summary: Expect 10 to 15 cm of snow to accumulate above 700 metres with lesser amounts down to 400 metres.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 60 to 80 mm of rain. Maximum rain rates mostly 15 to 25 mm/h, but localised downpours of 25 to 40 mm/h possible with thunderstorms. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal. Changes: Upgraded to orange rain warning.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited
